At camp, like in combat, the Bounty Hunter's strength lies in preparedness. He can take time to study his notes, bettering his odds against typical foes or even specifically 'big game'. Scouting ahead can increase a party's knowledge of lurking threats, while tracking increases the party's chance of surprising enemies.

Gameplay settings as intended to be played. Turning this OFF allows you to toggle the gameplay features below.

Show error messages for game errors. Useful for troubleshooting and bug reports.
Ensure more even long-term distribution of heroes in the Stage Coach.

This is what happens to carried trinkets when you have a total party wipe.
Dungeon map will auto-center on party when idle.
Collect anonymous usage data to help us make game adjustments.
Enemy crits multiply base damage, similar to players. If turned OFF, enemy crits just do max damage.
Whether heroes who have completed a Darkest Dungeon quest may re-enter that dungeon. Strict: may not enter. Permissive: may enter, but will be stressed out.
Show warnings related to embarking on a quest. This includes such things as not having much food or torches.
Show warnings when advancing from Quest Select to Provisioning phase. This includes such things as trinkets not being equipped, or other party warnings.
Combat retreats sometimes require multiple attempts to safely escape.
If enabled, active party members always appear at the top of the hero roster in town.

Normal campaigns are the "original" settings for the game. While there is no time limit to win, the campaign will be longer and more challenging than Radiant mode.
Bloodmoon campaigns are not for the faint of heart. Expect no quarter, no forgiveness. You must conquer the evil within a time and hero death limit. (Bloodmoon is Stygian + Crimson Court)
Stygian campaigns are not for the faint of heart. Expect no quarter, no forgiveness. You must conquer the evil within a time and hero death limit. Also, many gameplay settings are locked.
Radiant campaigns, while still challenging, are adjusted to be faster and more forgiving than normal. Suggested for your first Darkest Dungeon experience.
Let me share with you the terrible wonders I have come to know...
Short for "accuracy". Base chance to hit is ACC minus the enemy's DODGE.
An heirloom typically found in the Ruins. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
An ability used by a hero during Camping.
An ability used by a hero during combat.

Most dead monsters leave a temporary corpse. Corpses preserve the enemy order for a time and require heroes to use skills to attack around the corpses, move other enemies in reach, and so on. Alternatively, corpses can be attacked and cleared manually.
An heirloom found in all dungeons. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
Short for "critical hit chance". Critical hits do extra damage and provide stress relief (when a hero crits) or stress damage (when a monster crits).
A hit taken by a hero on Death's Door that permanently kills the hero.
A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door. Each subsequent hit taken while at Death's Door has a chance of permanently killing the hero.
A log of major events that occur at the Estate each week. Can be accessed while in the Hamlet.
An heirloom typically found in the Weald. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
A temporary sickness that debilitates the hero in some way. Can be cured by some combat skills or Camping skills, but usually needs treated in town at the Sanitarium.
Short for "damage". Determines how many health points, or HP, are removed from the target if an attack connects.
Dodge gets removed from the enemy's Accuracy to determine base chance to hit.
Commonly refers to the weapon and armor equipped to a hero, but can also include Trinkets. Weapons and armor cannot be unequipped but can be upgraded.
A type of provision used for Camping meals and other meals while wandering. Can be fed individually to a hero for a small boost in HP.
The basic currency of the Estate. Used to purchase Trinkets, learn and upgrade skills, and upgrade Equipment.
A heart attack occurs when a hero reaches 200 stress. This will drop a hero to Death's Door, or kill one already there.
A special currency type that is most often used to upgrade buildings in Town. There are four types of Heirlooms: Busts, Deeds, Portraits, and Crests.
A type of provision used to temporarily increase a hero's resistances. Also can be used on dungeon curios.

A temporary condition that may be triggered when a hero reaches 100 stress. Afflicted heroes act on their own and suffer stat penalties. Afflictions can be cured in town by reducing the hero's stress at the Abbey or the Tavern.
Short for "health points". HP is removed as damage is taken. A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door.
A type of provision used to cure a hero's combat debuffs. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
An effect that moves the target forward or backward in the party lineup.
Bonus towards resisting enemy moves that cause a position change.
An object found in dungeons that impedes the party's progress. They can be removed by hand or with a Shovel. Clearing an obstacle by hand inflicts DMG and stress on the entire party.
An heirloom typically found in the Warrens. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
Short for "protection". Indicates what percentage of incoming damage is mitigated. DOTs (bleed, blight) ignore PROT.
An item that can be added to the player's inventory before embarking on a quest.
A character trait on a hero. Quirks can be beneficial (positive) or hindering (negative). Heroes may start with some quirks but acquire more through adventuring.
A type of provision used to remove Blight. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
A stat that influences how likely a hero is to resist a particular status, such as Stun or Bleed.

The veteran level of a hero. A hero with higher Resolve Level can better resist stress, learn higher level skills and wield higher level equipment. Higher Resolve Level heroes will not waste their time on lower level quests. Low Resolve Level heroes adventuring in higher level dungeons will find it more stressful.
Earning Resolve XP progresses a hero towards the next Resolve Level. Resolve XP can only be earned by completing quests. Heroes do not earn Resolve XP if they abandon or fail quests.
The collection of all the player's hired heroes.
A type of provision. Used to clear obstacles to prevent taking DMG and stress.
A type of provision used on curios in dungeons.
Short for "speed". Speed influences the order in which combatants act. Initiative is re-rolled each round per combatant. Base value is 1-8, plus modifiers.
Accrues as heroes travel through dungeons and engage in combat. When a hero reaches 100 stress, she acquires either an Affliction or a Virtue. At 200 stress, the hero suffers a heart attack.
An effect that forces the hero or enemy to pass on his/her next turn.
A hero's armor determines her base DODGE and MAX HP. Armor can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
A type of provision. Used to increase the current torchlight within a dungeon.
The amount of light in a dungeon. Adventuring in brightness is safer but less rewarding, while adventuring in darknesss is more dangerous but more rewarding. Can be increased by using torches.
A bonus towards avoiding or disarming traps.
A temporary condition of increased effectiveness that a hero acquires after passing an Affliction Check. Virtued heroes have buffs and may buff or otherwise increase the power of their allies.
A type of equipment used by a hero to combat the dangers found in dungeons. A hero's weapon determines his/her base DMG, CRIT and SPD. Weapons can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
Made whenever a hero reaches 100 Stress and results in an Affliction or Virtue state.
Made at the beginning of each battle to determine which group is surprised. Surprised heroes have their order jumbled. Surprised enemies act last in the round.
A hidden log of which Afflictions a particular hero has a tendency to develop.
An interactive prop found in a dungeon hallway or room.
A type of provision used to remove Bleed. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
Limited number of times that a skill may be used in each combat.
Heroes or enemies with Bleed take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with bandages, combat skills, and Camping skills.
Heroes or enemies with Blight take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with antivenom, combat skills, and Camping skills.
A tincture useful in the treatment of Horror (stress DOT)

Darkest Dungeon is about making the most of a bad situation. Quests will fail or must be abandoned. Heroes will die. And when they die, they stay dead. Progress autosaves constantly, so actions are permanent.

The game expects a lot out of you. How far will you push your adventurers? How much are you willing to risk in your quest to restore the Hamlet? What will you sacrifice to save the life of your favorite hero?
Thankfully, there are always fresh souls arriving on the stage coach, seeking both adventure and fame in the shadow of the...

I've seen enough of the Darkest Dungeon to last a lifetime.
The geometry of the place...it was all wrong!

The exertions of adventuring have produced a growing hunger amongst the party.
The human mind - fragile like a robin's egg.
The mind cannot hope to withstand such an assult.
Even the aged oak will fall to the tempest's winds.
One can sometimes find clarity in madness, but only rarely...
Madness - sublimity of the intelligence, or so it has been said.
The bulwarks of the mind have fallen!
Frustration and fury, more destructive than a hundred cannons.
There can be no hope in this hell, no hope at all.
Fear and frailty finally claim their due.
Reeling, gasping, taken over the edge into madness!
Those who covet injury find it in no short supply.
The walls close in, the shadows whisper of conspiracy!
Self-preservation is paramount - at any cost!
Towering, fierce, terrible. Nightmare made material!
Even in death, the captain shouts his orders, and the crew obeys...
The aquatic devils have remade the poor girl in their image! She is their queen, and their slave!
The madman hides there, behind the pews, spouting his mindless drivel!
You still foolishly consider yourself an entity separate from the whole. I know better, and I. Will. Show you.
The flesh is fluid it can be changed, reshaped, remade!
The flesh is immortal, it is undying! Pray it does not take too hideous a form...
Behold the Heart of the World! Progenitor of life, Father and Mother, Alpha and Omega - our creator and our destroyer!
Do not consider my continued commentary disingenuous. Each victory out here in the world brings you closer to heart of things
Survival is a tenuous proposition in this sprawling tomb.
More blood soaks the soil, feeding the evil therein.
Another life wasted in the pursuit of glory and gold.
This is no place for the weak, or the foolhardy.
More dust, more ashes, more disappointment.
Perched at the very precipice of oblivion...
Teetering on the brink, facing the abyss!
And now the true test...hold fast, or expire?
As life ebbs, terrible vistas of emptiness reveal themselves.
Mortality clarified in a single strike.
Death waits for slightest lapse in concentration...
Such a terrible assault cannot be left unanswered...
Ringing ears, blurred vision - the end approaches...
A dizzying blow to body and brain!
A setback, but not the end of things.
Wounds to be tended; lessons to be learned.
Regroup. Reassemble. Evil is timeless, after all.
Failure tests the mettle of heart, brain, and body.
You will endure this loss, and learn from it.
We fall so that we may learn to pick ourselves up once again.
Do not ruminate on this fleeting failure - the campaign is long, and victory will come.
Where there is no peril in the task, there can be no glory in its accomplishment.
Ignorance of your enemy and of yourself will invariably lead to defeat.
Great adversity has a beauty - it is the fire that tempers the blade.
You cannot learn a thing you think you know...
Injury and despondence set the stage for heroism... or cowardice.
Without tools of iron, you must rely on flesh and indefatiguable purpose.
Even the cold stone seems bent on preventing passage.
Such blockages are unsurprising - these tunnels predate even the earliest settlers.
Nature herself, a victim to the spreading corruption, malformed with misintent.
True desperation is known only when escape is impossible.
Cornered! Trapped! And forced to fight on...
No chance for egress - will this be a massacre?
Gnawing hunger sets in, turning the body against itself, weakening the mind.
To fall for such a little thing...a bite of bread!
Packs full of steel and war, but nary a thought given to the plow!
No force of will can overcome a failing body.
The requirements of survival cannot be met on an empty stomach.
The darkness holds much worse than mere trickery and boogey-men.
Darkess closes in, haunting the hearts of men.
Terrors may indeed stalk these shadows, but yonder, a glint of gold!
Secrets and wonders can be found in the most tenebrous corners of this place.
...And now the darkness holds dominion - black as death.
Cruel machinations spring to life with a singular purpose!
Curious is the trap-maker's art...his efficacy unwitnessed by his own eyes.
Mechanical hazards, posessed by evil intent!
Ancient traps lie in wait, unsprung and thirsting for blood.
Carelessness will find no clemency in this place!
Mind that such missteps are the exception, and not the rule.
It is a travesty; an accident given form - a blundering mountain of hatred and rage.
Squirming, contorting and ever-expanding...this horror must be unmade!
Twisted and maniacal - a slathering testament to the powers of corruption!
A marvel of technology - an engine of destruction!
As the ghoulish collection scatters, the rats prepare to feast.
A predator is often blind to its own peril.
The twisted faces of the damned, piled high and cloaked in malice!
The sparkling eyes of youth - melded and made merciless!
Compassion is a rarity in the fevered pitch of battle.
The wounds of war can be healed, but never hidden.
The blood pumps! The limbs obey!
Patched up, if only to bleed again.
Death cannot be escaped, but it can be postponed...
Death is patient. It will wait.
A brilliant confluence of skill and purpose!
A time to perform beyond one's limits!
Gnawing uncertainty - the birthplace of dread.
The abyss returns even the boldest gaze!
Impressive haul, if you value such things.
Such a burden of finery risks life and limb...
A full pack often attracts ...unwanted attention.
The space between worlds is no place for mortal men.
It could be dismissed as a fever dream, if not for the corpses.
Behold the infinite malignity of the stars!
and what sleeps is aroused once more.
To hatch from this fragile shell of earth and rock,
So, seek solace in a manner befitting your lineage,
and take up your nugatory vigil,
haunted forever by that sickening prose,
echoing through the infinite blackness of space and time.
Ruin has come to our family.
We are born of this thing,
and we will be returned to it in time.
Until the stars align in their inexorable formation
A moment of valor shines brightest against a backdrop of despair.
Even reanimated bones can fall; even the dead can die again.
A moment of respite, a chance to steel oneself against the coming horrors.
A spark without kindling is a goal without hope.
Circle in the dark. The battle may yet be won.
Gathered close, in tenuous firelight and uneasy companionship...
Huddled together, furtive and vulnerable. Rats in a maze.
Finally, a sailor's death for captain and crew. Fitting.
They are cursed to float forever, deep in the swirling blackness, far beyond the light's reach.
Hideous matriarch, vile queen of the aphotic depths - she has no place in the sane world!
Seafaring trade, the lifeblood of any port, can resume again now that the routes are safe.
The pungent odour abates! The things are driven back, for a time.
At last, wholesome marine life can flourish - if indeed there is such a thing.
Despite its morbid aspect, this twisted, cavernous maze seems almost traversable.
We will find all manner of great and terrible things in this watery tomb...
This day belongs to the Light!
Beacons in the darkness, stars in the emptiness of the void.
With no living sinew to actuate them, will these walking bones finally fail?
Did he foresee his own demise? I care not, so long as he remains dead.
In life, his claims to precognition were dubious at best, in death, they are ridiculous.
More bones returned to rest. Devils remanded to their abyss.
Room by room, hall by hall, we reclaim what is ours.
The shifted corridors and sloped vaults of our ancestry are beginning to feel familiar.
The great Ruins belong to us, and we will find whatever secrets they hold.
Tokens of hope, recovered from the encroaching dark.
The Abbot will be grateful - the trappings of his faith have been restored.
The bigger the beast, the greater the glory.
A victory - perhaps a turning point!
Prodigous size alone does not dissuade the sharpened blade.
Monstrous size has no intrinsic merit, unless inordinate exsanguination be considered a virtue...
Great is the weapon that cuts on its own.
Slowly, gently, this is how a life is taken.
Another abomination cleansed from our lands!
As the fiend falls, a faint hope blossoms.
Confidence surges as the enemy crumbles!
Press this advantage, give them no quarter!
Their formation is broken - maintain the offensive!
Continue the onslaught! Destroy. Them. All.
Glittering gold, trinkets and baubles, paid for in blood.
If only treasure could staunch the flow of otherworldy corruption.
Finding the stuff is only the first test, now it must be carried home.
Packs laden with loot are often low on supplies.
Wealth beyond measure, awarded to the brave and foolhardy alike.
A fortune waiting to be spent...
A handsome reward for a task well performed.
This skirmish may be lost, but the battle may yet be won.
A wise general cuts losses and regroups.
The sin is not in being outmatched, but in failing to recognize it.
The light, the promise of safety!
The way is lit. The path is clear. We require only the strength to follow it.
In radiance may we find victory!
As the light gains purchase, spirits are lifted and purpose is made clear.
The match is struck, a blazing star is born!
These nightmarish creatures can be felled, they can be beaten!
Remind yourself that overconfidence is a slow and insidious killer.
A trifling victory, but a victory nonetheless.
This expedition, at least, promises success.
As victories mount, so too will resistance.
Be wary - triumphant pride precipitates a dizzying fall...
Ghoulish horrors - brought low and driven into the mud!
Seize this momentum - push on to the task's end!
Success, so clearly in view. Or, is it merely a trick of the light?
A moment of clarity in the eye of the storm...
Many fall in the face of chaos; but not this one, not today.
Adversity can foster hope, and resilience!
Ha ha! Let those dirty beasts worshop the mud now!
Robbed of their writings, the Swine will grow ever more ignorant - if such a thing were possible.
How many rats will it take to gnaw through a tonne of putrid flesh?
The thing is even more horrible in death. Liquefaction cannot come soon enough.
It is as grotesque in death as it was in life...
Its destruction is a small consolation, given the implications of its terrible existence.
Some experiments should have never happened. You are doing just work, ending them.
Their squeals fade, their confidence is shaken!
The swinefolk's labyrinth may yet prove to be navigable.
The twisting tunnels seem a little less ...impossible.
These foodstuffs yield double benefit: the town may eat, and the Swine will not.
Our supplies are replenished, the soldiers will feast tonight.
Good fortune and hard work may yet arrest this plague.
The wood is still poisoned. The way is still blocked. But less people will be eaten.
Let her corpse to rot, consumed by the spores she spawned.
A corpse of twisted metal and splintered wood - at home amongst the headstones.
The Brigands are undone - our family crest is once again a symbol of strength!
Driving out corruption is an endless battle, but one that must be fought.
The agents of pestilence will yet be driven from our woods!
Every cleared path and charted route reduces the isolation of our troubled estate.
Paths and roads bring soldiers and supplies, let them arrive unharried!
These medicines will prevent the outbreak of epidemic at our struggling Hamlet.
These tonics and herbs will stave off infection and neutralize contagion.
Ruin has come to our family.
I bent every effort towards the excavation and recovery
exhausting what remained of our family fortune
on swarthy workmen and sturdy shovels.
At last, in the salt-soaked crags beneath the lowest foundations
we unearthed that damnable portal and antediluvian evil.
Our every step unsettled the ancient earth
but we were in a realm of death and madness!
In the end, I alone fled laughing and wailing
through those blackened arcades of antiquity.
Gazing proudly from its stoic perch above the moor.
I lived all my years in that ancient, rumor shadowed manor.
And yet, I began to tire of conventional extravagance.
Singular, unsettling tales suggested the mansion itself
was a gateway to some fabulous and unnamable power.
Prying eyes had become a nuisance along the Old Road, and so I undertook to receive my most curious deliveries by way of marine shipments.
A sheltered jetty was accessible by a narrow stone stair off the back of the manor, and a discreet system of pulleys could
hoist even the heaviest prizes up the rock face from a securely tied dinghy below.
I employed a crew of particularly unsavory mariners, who, for a time, sailed the four corners at my behest -
retrieving many valuable artifacts, relics and rare texts. Predictably, they increased their tariffs to counter my intense
stipulations of secrecy. Such resources had long been exhausted, of course, and so I prepared an ...alternative payment.
While the greedy dogs slept off their revelry, I hexed their anchor with every twisted incantation I could muster -
imbuing it with the weight of my ambition, and my contempt for their crude extortion.
At the witching hour, the anchor pulled with preternatural force, dragging craft and crew down into the depths.
They must have cried out, but no sound escaped the swirling black waters...
My lofty position wasnt always accompanied by the fear of office, and there was a time I could walk the streets or raise
a glass in the tavern without concern for molestation. Faithful as the tide, one precocious village waif made it her hobby
to shadow my every errand. It was charming then, troublesome later.
In financial desperation, I struck a bargain with the ancient things that surfaced in search of sacrifice when the moon was right.
Their price was the delivery of an obscure idol and one other item of more troubling portent.
The pact struck, my newfound accomplices slipped silently beneath the brackish water.
A fearful stirring at the edge of the torchlight betrayed a familiar witness, and gifted me with malign inspiration.
Under the blood moon, I lured my wide-eyed prey to the piers edge.
Before she could properly appreciate her position, I clamped on a manacle, chaining her to the leering idol.
A small push was sufficient to send both into the icy waters. And when at length the tide receded, jewels of the most magnificent
grandeur lay scattered upon the shore.
Mastery over life and death was chief among my early pursuits. I began in humility, but my ambition was limitless.
Who could have divined the prophetic import of something as unremarkable as a twitch in the leg of dead rat?
I entertained a delegation of experts from overseas, eager to plumb the depths of their knowledge and share with them certain
techniques and alchemical processes I had found to yield wondrous and terrifying results.
Having learned all I could from my visiting guests, I murdered them as they slept.
I brought my colleagues back with much of their intellect intact, a remarkable triumph for even the most experienced necromancer.
Freed from the trappings of their humanity, they plied their terrible trade anew - the dead reviving the dead, on and on down the years...
Excavations beneath the Manor were well underway, when a particularly ragged indigent arrived in the Hamlet.
This filthy, toothless degenerate boasted an uncanny knowledge of my ambitions, and prognosticated to all who would listen
that I would soon unleash doom upon the world.
This raving creature had to be silenced, but, to my bafflement, doing so proved maddeningly impossible.
How had he survived the stockades, the icy waters, and the knives I delivered so enthusiastically into his back? How had
he returned time and time again to rouse the townsfolk with his wild speculations and prophecies?
Finally, resigned to his uncommon corporeal resilience, I lured him to the dig.
There, I showed him the Thing, and detailed the full extent of my plans.
Triumphantly, I watched as he tore his eyes from their sockets, and ran shrieking into the shadows -
wailing maniacally that the end was upon us all.
The ways and rituals of blood sacrifice are difficult to master.
Those from beyond require a physical vessel if they are to make the crossing into our reality. The timing of the chants is imperative -
without the proper utterances at precise intervals, the process can fail spectacularly.
My first attempts at summoning were crude and the results, disappointing.
I soon found however, that the type and condition of the host's meat was a critical factor.
The best results came from pigs, whose flesh is most like that of man.
The Great Thing I had managed to bring through was brutish and stupid.
Moreover, it required prodigious amounts of meat to sustain itself, but this was only a trifling concern after all, I
had a village full of it.
My zeal for blood rituals and summoning rites had begun to ebb as each attempt invariably brought only failure, and disappointment.
Progress was halting, and the rapidly accumulating surplus of wasted flesh had become...burdensome.
I could not store such a prodigious amount of offal, nor could I rid myself of it easily, possessed as was by unnameable
things from outer spheres. When excavations beneath the Manor broke through into an ancient network of aqueducts and tunnels,
I knew I had found a solution to the problem of disposal.
The spasmodically squirming, braying, and snorting half-corpses were heaped each upon the other until at last I was rid of them.
The Warrens became a landfill of snout and hoof, gristle and bone a mountainous, twitching mass of misshapen carcasses
fusing themselves together in the darkness.
I had collected many rare and elusive volumes on ancient herbal properties, and was set to enjoy several weeks immersed in comfortable study.
My work was interrupted, however, by a singularly striking young woman who insisted on repeated calls to the house.
Her knowledge of horticulturalism, and its role in various arcane practices impressed me greatly.
My licentious impulse gave way to a genuine, professional respect, and together, we began to plant, harvest, and brew.
As time wore on, her wild policy of self-experimentation grew intolerable.
She quaffed all manner of strange fungii, herbs and concoctions, intent on gaining some insight into the horror we both knew
to be growing beneath us. The change in her was appalling, and, no longer able to stomach it, I sent her to live in the
Weald, where her wildness would be welcomed.
Simple folk are by their nature loquacious, and the denizens of the Hamlet were no exception.
It was not long before rumors of my morbid genius and secretive excavations began to fuel local legend.
In the face of my increasingly egregious flaunting of public taboos, awe turned to ire, and demonstrations were held in the town square.
The wild whispers of heresy roused the rabble to violent action.
Such was the general air of rebellion that even my generous offer of gold to the local constabulary was rebuffed!
To reassert my rule, I sought out unscrupulous men skilled in the application of force. Tight-
lipped and terrifying, these mercenaries brought with them a war machine of terrible implication.
Eager to end the tiresome domestic distraction, I instructed my newly formed militia of hardened bandits, brigands and killers
to go forth and do their work. Compliance and order were restored, and the noisome population of the Hamlet was culled to more ...
The human mind - fragile like a robin's egg.
The mind cannot hope to withstand such an assult.
Towering, fierce, terrible. Nightmare made material!
Survival is a tenuous proposition in this sprawling tomb.
More blood soaks the soil, feeding the evil therein.
Another life wasted in the pursuit of glory and gold.
Perched at the very precipice of oblivion...
Injury and despondence set the stage for heroism... or cowardice.
Without tools of iron, you must rely on flesh and indefatiguable purpose.
Knawing hunger sets in, turning the body against itself, weakening the mind.
The darkness holds much worse than mere trickery and boogey-men.
Cruel machinations spring to life with a singular purpose!
A moment of valor shines brightest against a backdrop of despair.
Even reanimated bones can fall; even the dead can die again.
A moment of respite, a chance to steel oneself against the coming horrors.
A spark without kindling is a goal without hope.
As the fiend falls, a faint hope blossoms.
Glittering gold, trinkets and baubles, paid for in blood.
These nightmarish creatures can be felled, they can be beaten!
A devil walks these halls...only the mad or the desperate go in search of him.
The flopping, fish-like things abhore the warding sigils. Let us claim this place anew!
These salt-soaked caverns are teeming with pelagic nightmares- they must be flushed out!
The smell of rotting fish is almost unbearable, but we must find its source...
Recover these lost shipments of rarities, that we may prevent them from falling into even less scrupulous hands...
The poor devils, chained and drowning for eternity...
I always wondered what became of the unfortunate little waif...
Can the defiled be consecrated? Can the fallen find rest?
The fiends must be driven back, and what better place to begin than the seat of our noble line?
Pace out the halls of your lineage, once familar, now foreign.
There is power in symbols. Collect the scattered scraps of faith and give comfort to the masses.
The echoes of his mindless tittering reverbate maddeningly - he must be silenced!
The blood of the fallen flows ever downward along these titan spires - the creature fattens itself on your failures...
Once again, the stars are right, and the Manor sits at very the epicenter of cosmic unrest.
Cultists rally to their twisted idols, and great gongs sound in anticipation of the coming sacrifices. Far below, life-
laden shadows pulse to the unrelenting rhythm of a beating heart...
You have merely glimpsed the edge of the abyss, but it is enough to trigger the cycle of revelation.
Now, like me, you will begin to see things as they truly are...
Madness made flesh! It crawls steadily upward from the pit, supported by the lattice of cyclopean pillars...
The thing has no name, for it needs no language. Nevertheless, those who would submit to its wordless will thing are rewarded,
in a fashion. The creature's blessings are as repulsive as they are robust. Twisted, half-human monstrosities stalk the flesh-
ridden halls, protecting their gestating god.
The maniacal cultists are quelled for a time, but there can be no celebration.
Your progress is measured only in progressive realization, and dawning horror. You are in the shadow of the end.
The Gateless Gate. A maddening aperture to realms beyond human understanding...
The interminable stone halls are but an antechamber! The creature is vast beyond measure, and must be battled from within.
Step over the threshold and let the terrible truth worm its way into your mind.
At last, the twisted heart of the world is laid bare for sword, or supplication.
Life feeds on life. In your petty pursuit of family redemption, you consume those who rally to your cause, and in so doing,
you strengthen the Thing - accelerating the end! This is as it should be...it is why you are here.
In all my terrible researches, what I sought was a glimpse behind the veil a crumb of cosmic truth.
I found it here, and in that moment of brain-blasting realization, I ceased to be a man, and became a Herald, an Avatar of
We are chained here forever, you and I, at the end of the world.
Free yourself, rouse the Thing, and embrace the ineffable cosmic hideousness that lives within us all.
A devil walks these halls...only the mad or the desperate go in search of him.
The Swine draw power from their horrid markings and crude idols - tear them down!
They breed quickly down there in the dark, but perhaps we can slay them even faster.
To prosecute our war against the Swine, we must first scout their squalid homes.
The fiercest beast will lay down when it has not eaten. Steal their food.
A nameless abomination, a testament to my failures - it must be destroyed!
The thing is more terrible than I can describe - an incoherent jumble of organ, sinew and bone.
Excise the fungal tumors and the land may yet live.
Corruption has soaked the soil, sapping all good life from these groves - let us burn it out this evil.
I knew all these paths once; now they are as twisted as my own ambitions.
Our land is remote and unneighbored. Every lost resource must be recovered.
There is method in the wild corruption here. It bears a form both wretched and malevolent.
The smell of sulfur and gunpowder hangs in the air, the war machine is close.
You will arrive along the old road.
It winds with a troubling, serpent-like suggestion
and remember there can be no bravery
The old road will take you hell
There is a sickness in the ancient pitted cobbles
you will face viciousness, violence, and perhaps
Once, our Estate was the envy of this land.
I remember days when the sun shone, and laughter could be heard from the Tavern.
I was lord of this place, before the crows and rats made it their domain.
I see something long-absent in the sunken faces of passersby -- a glimmer of hope.
In truth, I cannot tell how much time has passed since I sent that letter.
The poor Cartetaker, I fear his longstanding duties here have ...affected him.
The degeneracy of the Hamlet is nothing, I fear, when compared to the condition of surrounding acres.
My obsession caused this great foulness, and it is shameful that I must rely upon you to set it right.
Our family name, once so well regarded, is now barely whispered aloud by decent folk.
I can still see their angry faces as they stormed the manor, but I was dead before they found me, and the letter was on its way.
There is a great horror beneath the manor -a Crawling Chaos that must be destroyed!
Curiosity, interest and obsession - mile markers on my road to damnation.
Trouble yourself not with the cost of this crusade - its noble end affords you broad tolerance in your choice of means.
In time, you will know the tragic extent of my failings.
Let me share with you the terrible wonders I have come to know...
You answered the letter - now like me, you are part of this place.
We dug for months, years - an eternity. And we were rewarded with madness.
The plume and the pistol - a fitting end to my folly, and a curse upon us all.
All the decadent horrors I have seen pale in comparison with that upon which I dared not look...
Can you feel it? The walls between the sane world and that unplumbed dimension of delirium are tenously thin here...
All my life, I could feel an insistent gnawing in the back of my mind.
It was a yearning, a thirst for discovery that could be neither numbed, nor sated.
An eternity of futile struggle - a penance for my unspeakable transgressions.
Another soul battered and broken. Cast aside like a spent torch.
Those without the stomach for this place must move on.
Send this one to journey elsewhere, for we have need of sterner stock.
Suffer not the lame horse, nor the broken man.
This one has become vestigial. Useless.
The task ahead is terrible, and weakness cannot be tolerated.
It is done. Turn yourself now to the condition of those poor devils who remain.
Slumped shoulders, wild eyes, and a stumbling gait - this one is no more good.
There is, indeed, no better place for those in search of rarities and forgotten lore...
Risk and reward - a siren's call to the enterprising stalker.
Behold - righteousness and zealotry - gleaming in the morning sun.
There will be no sleep tonight - the wild shouts and frantic drumming will see to that.
Cast out from the 'civilized' world, these men may yet be of use to us.
They meet in secret, that none may know the horrifying depths of their inquiries.
Let the organ notes ring out from the Abbey - the Sisters are gathering...
Back across the styx - Boatman be damned!
No rest, no peace for this wretched soul.
Your soldiers' minds are mired in malignancy - fear has taken root!
The frothing waters subside; the advantage is ours!
The shuffling dead are silenced - we have claimed dominion over the Ruins once more!
A fever of wilfull determination sweeps through the barracks!
The twisting tunnels no longer exhale the toxic stench of degeneracy...
Pallid light filters its way through the rotting boughs...let us press on!
Take advantage of this faith-fueled charity - it will not last.
The town is alive with wild merriment and desperate jubilation!
Finally the serum is working, and the side-effects are... manageable.
The preponderance of rare and exotic injuries make this place perfect for the study of suffering.
Death and demise - cause for celebration!
The man is slave to the beast, and the beast is slave to the moon.
To the resourceful thief, burials are merely... ephemeral affairs.
The shadows hide the guilty and guilt-ridden alike...
Seditionists and heretics skulk in the alleys - they must be found out!
Tonight, the fools make merry. Tomorrow, they die laughing.
Strength, purpose, and peace - all can be found in the focused mind.
A new enemy - insipid and incurable.
Perhaps things are not as bad as they seem... (laughter)
A ray of sunlight. A beacon of golden hope.
Windows and doors will be bolted. Tonight, something haunts the dark.
A troubling shortage of ale...and a notable absence of good humour.
Any evidence of excessive exertions must be made scarce. After all, apearances must be maintained...
No amount of scrubbing can remove the stains of such fearsome piety.
The beating heart of the gambling hall - now bloodless and still.
Ancient and crumbling, the Abbey's masonry fares no better than the faith of its congregation.
Woe to the sheep, for does the absence of the shepherd not invite the wolves?
Their customs are curious, and their generosity is notoriously short-lived.
Flames on the horizon, sulfur in the air - the wolves are at the door!
What little there is must suffice, for the time being.
Surplus - a rare and wonderful thing!
A modest offering from those few surrounding farms yet untouched by the spreading calamity.
Let each help the other, and in so doing, help themselves...
An exquisite example of craftsmanship... and futility.
Even these dirt-covered dullards have their uses - put them to work!
A finely crafted instrument of butchery and bloodshed - yours for the taking.
Tortured and reclusive, this man is more dangerous than he seems.
She searches where others will not go - and sees what others will not see.
Shoot, bandage, and pillage - the dancing steps of war!
The thrill of the hunt, the promise of payment.
A mighty sword arm anchored by holy purpose - a zealous warrior!
To those with a keen eye - gold gleams like a dagger's point.
To those with a keen eye - gold gleams like a dagger's point.
Barbaric rage and unrelenting savagery make for a powerful ally.
Elusive, evasive, persistent - righteous traits, for a rogue.
A lawman and his faithful beast - a bond forged by battle and bloodshed.
He will be laughing still, at the end.
This man understands that adversity and existence are one and the same.
The raw strength of youth may be spent, but his eyes hold the secrets of a hundred campaigns.
A champion markswoman - keen for a new kind of challenge.
To fight the abyss, one must know it.
What better laboratory than the blood-soaked battlefield?
A sister of battle - pious and unrelenting!
A little hope, however desperate, is never without worth.
Gilded icons and dogmatic rituals...for some, a tonic against the bloodshed.
A man in a robe, claiming communion with the divine. Madness.
In the end, every plan relies upon a strong arm and tempered steel.
Fan the flames! Mold the metal! We are raising an army!
A sharper sword, a stronger shield - anything to prolong a soldier's life.
Alone in the woods or tunnels, survival is the same. Prepare, persist, and overcome.
They must learn more than brutal bloodletting - they must learn to survive!
Some may fall, but their knowledge lives on.
Every creature has a weakness. The wise hero trains for what she will face.
A strict regimen is paramount, if one is to master the brutal arithmetic of combat.
Rarities and curios, sold at a profit, of course.
Idol, amulet, or lucky charm - the simplest object can be a talisman against evil.
An increasing stockpile of curious trinkets, gathered from forbidden places.
The front line of this war is not in the dungeon, but rather, inside the mind.
Experimental techniques and tonics can overcome things a sharpened sword cannot.
Curious methodologies and aperatus' can calm even the most tormented soul.
Great heroes can be found even here, in the mud and rain.
Word is traveling. Ambition is stirring in distant cities. We can use this.
More arrive, foolishly seeking fortune and glory in this domain of the damned.
With enough ale, maybe they can be inured against the horrors below.
Strong drink, a game of chance, and companionship. The rush of life.
All manner of diversion and dalliance await those who cross the threshold with coin in hand.
The cobwebs have been dusted, the pews set straight. The Abbey calls to the faithful...
Dispatch this thug in brutal fashion, that all may hear of your arrival!
The bellows blast once again! The forge stands ready to make weapons of war.
Leave nothing unchecked, there is much to be found in forgotten places.
Brigands have the run of these lanes, keep to the side path, the Hamlet is just ahead.
Most will end up here, covered in the poisoned earth, awaiting merciful oblivion.
Make no mistake, we will face ever greater threats. Our soldiers must be ready.
Trinkets and charms, gathered from all the forgotten corners of the earth...
The cost of preparedness - measured now in gold, later in blood.
This sprawling estate, a mecca of madness and morbidity. Your work begins...
Women and men; soldiers and outlaws; fools and corpses. All will find their way to us now that the road is clear.
At home in wild places, she is a stalwart survivor, and a strict instructor.
Fresh kegs, cards, and curtained rooms promise solace to the weary and the broken alike.
Welcome home, such as it is. This squalid hamlet, these corrupted lands, they are yours now, and you are bound to them.
An ambush! Send these vermin a message: the rightful owner has returned, and their kind is no longer welcome.
The Warrens is full of disease and blight in equal measure... come prepared to deal with sickness.
The Swine are resistant to disease, thanks to their unclean living.
The tunnels are often blocked by piled stones and bodies. It's dirty work to remove by hand.

These tunnels are often blocked by piled stones and bodies. It's dirty work to remove by hand.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...

Beast and corrupted human alike inhabit these failing groves.

Beware the mark of death that Fungal Artillery can put on you. It tells their Fungal Zombie brethren what to kill.
The paths are littered with poisonous traps.

You don't have four heroes available for a quest. You will need to recruit more heroes at the Stage Coach or remove some heroes from treatment.
...the recently recovered cache has excited local enthusiasts, and drawn the attention of experts in the neighboring regions.
Quiet and reserved, these men are professionals, compelled not by the scent of blood, but rather the gleam of gold.
...inexplicably however, only two have arrived. It appears that the Abbot's earnest appeal has been answered, albeit with mocking cruelty.
Debaucherous and decadent in the extreme, several nomadic warriors have wandered into the Hamlet in search of a glorious death. We can only hope they find it quickly.
One cannot help but admire these unfortunate souls - they bear their burden with a grace and humility seldom seen in the able-bodied.
While strange utterances and unsettling chants typically characterize such events, we have been assured there is no real danger present in the rituals themselves.
The Sisters of St. Martha's will lead the service with a chorus of 'We Are the Flame', after which they will be accepting confessions in the lower hall.
By hateful curse or malign miracle, it seems even death may be defied in this damnable place. Only ONE of these soldiers can be returned to the living...
Despondency and ambivalence seem to be on the wind. Many adventurers confess to having a troubled disposition, even here, in the relative safety of the Hamlet
Superstitious mariners rejoiced earlier today at news that unspeakable eldritch evils no longer threaten their cargo.
Reports from the hill cottages confirm a welcome reduction in the general aire of malaise in and around the old Ruins.
They were a fearsome lot - gritted teeth, distant stares; and between them, an unbreakable bond of fellowship.
West side residents have expressed relief at the abatement of the nauseating odour emanating from the ancient aqueducts.
Wholesome plant life has been spotted in the surrounding wood - a rarity in these parts.
The Abbey will be decorated for the duration of the event, and all are welcome to visit during the extended hours.
The town is alight with a spirit of goodwill and revelry, but this life-affirming attitude is not predicted to last long.
The time and gold were not spent in vain, however, as today caregivers announced they have succeeded in concocting an effective antidote.
Among the visiting delegation are experts in corporeal and cognitive disability, as well as several forensic specialists.
The Tavern will be open later than normal throughout the celebration, and residents are asked to maintain some semblance of decorum when leaving after midnight.
...and it is during such lunar phases that many residents report shrieks and howls of the most profoundly unnerving quality.
The keenest eye and steadiest hand will prevail during this week's tournament. The winner will claim the coveted Caretaker's Cup.
Most curious of all, however, is the absence of any evidence in the crypt itself. Nevertheless, the chest was found open, its contents conspicuously missing.
In the ensuing melee, two of the men escaped the scene and are said to be at large. They are most assuredly armed, dangerous, and desperate.
Threats to our collective safety are never in short supply, but this week our local constabulary received a welcome augmentation...
The music itself is damnably familiar, and yet, strangely unplaceable. Is it the instrument's odd tuning, or some inhuman quality in the bard's fingers?
The veteran Sergeant will be demonstrating his training regimen at the Guild Hall every night for the next week. All those concerned with self-preservation are encouraged to attend.
The shadow of sickness and disease has cast itself upon our Hamlet, and with it - panic.
...and while the campaign continues to drag on, recent events have emboldened the standing roster. Confidence is reported to be at an all-time high.
This pleasant weather comes as a welcome change, particularly for those currently enjoying a period of convalescence.
...as one man put it, Somethin' ain't right with them shadows - movin' and twistin' as they do.". Residents are advised to stay indoors until daybreak."
Ironically, those most vocal concerning the current dearth of spirits and mead are the same patrons whose unrestrained exuberance the night before exhausted the supply.
Bedsheets and pillowcases gleam white on the line, their lascivious history easily erased, unlike the consciences of those who sullied them.
The Abbot will not comment on the condition of the Penance Hall at this time, except to say that he expects normal operations to be resumed shortly.
Operations will be suspended temporarily, but given the limited avenues of egress from the Hamlet, officials are optimistic the thieves will be apprehended shortly.
Indeed, the elements have not been kind to the old Abbey; the very soil itself seems to reject the place. Work is expected to last through the week.
The Abbot has sequestered himself in the wine cellar, ostensibly to consider how best to help his parisioners cope with the deluge of godless horrors that plague these lands.
The collection is indeed impressive, and all the more appealing when one takes notice of the discounted prices.
Stunned by the apparent value of the thing concealed amidst its putrid feathers, onlookers wondered if a trek to its perch might not be in order...
To arms! A Brigand raiding party is descending upon the Hamlet with explosive fury and murderous intent!
Yet another cargo vessel has sunk off the coast, and the surviving crew have proven distressingly evasive concerning the particulars of this latest nautical nightmare.
Met at the bridge by a jubilant crowd, the Caretaker credits a thick fog and an early departure time for the wagon's safe arrival.
Nearby farmers have banded together, increasing security in an effort to protect the healthy livestock and crops upon which the Hamlet depends.
Putting ego aside does not come easily to such seasoned survivors, but the new recruits are palpably grateful for the assistance.
In the end, however, the damnable thing managed to get away with its prize; the Hamlet's coffers all the poorer for having hosted the unwanted guest.
He stayed up working for days, inspired by the rare quality of his materials, and determined to do them justice with his own skill.
Historically, seasonal labourers have been loath to make the journey along the Old Road, but harsh economic conditions have driven them to desperation.
In the end, the hours of rooting through the old barrels and forgotten weapon racks bore fruit!
The Shrieker has stolen %d of your trinkets!

All Stress Relief Activities Less Effective

Your party is not fully outfitted with trinkets. Really embark?
You haven't purchased much food for your expedition. It's recommended to take at least %d food for this quest. Still Embark?
A fish on two legs? Test the strength of this new menace.
Unholy abominations turning the Light against itself. Meet them in battle and learn how they fight.
An exploratory sortie into a mad realm of tunnels. Meet the enemy in battle, and then fade to safety with newfound information.
Beat back the creatures and bandits that endanger traffic on the Old Road.
Take the fight to the waters and show them our landward strength.
They can be killed. They can be beaten.
They can be killed. They can be beaten. Starting now.
Infection spreads unless checked. Put a tourniquet on the festering wood by destroying any creature you encounter.
This aquatic cult respects nothing but force. Leave a trail of scales and gills and let them dwell on that.
There are times for strategy, and times for brute force. Send the undead back to the hells from which they were summoned. All of them.
The swinefolk are growing in strength and numbers. Cut them like diseased wheat.
Endless winding paths all arive at the same place: the enemy. Bring war to the Weald.
Scout the unwholesome rocky formations beneath the Manor for signs of life.
Test yourself in the mad realm of your fallen ancestor. Take note of how the creatures have taken over, but don't delve too far.
The beast-men spill forth from a thousand gaping holes. Pick one and search its extents.
Take the Old Road into the wood and then pick any of the dozens of dark paths. Test that path and then return with your heads intact.
Plunge into forgotten grottos and assess the cancerous extent of the fishfolk's domain.
Unholy machinations have crushed together hallway and vault. Explore your ancestral home as far as you are able.
Explore the Warrens. With a better understanding of where the creatures are coming from, future raids can target their sources of power.
The Old Road is obscured by the corrupted, poisoned overgrowth. Explore and return with a full description of every side path you visit.
Follow every cavern and grotto to its conclusion and discover from whence the malign currents flow.
Is an apocalypse building? Cinch your packs and delve far, far into the tunnels of your fallen family. Make a map of your expedition.
Gain entry to the network of tunnels and take them to every possible extent you can manage. Return with a complete map.
The Weald was nearly inscrutable even before the corruption. Now it is nothing but dark mystery. Provision well and mount an expedition to map as much ground as you can.
Your Ancestor was receiving eldritch relics via marine shipments. Find and return them to town where they can be stored safely out of the hands of greater evils.
When the Estate was overrun, so too were many treasures and symbols of the Light. The Abbot will pay dearly for such relics.
The swine's appetite for comestibles exceeds even their thirst for blood. Winter is always close, and the Hamlet would do well to restock its sparse larder.
Many a cart-driver has met their end while traversing the Weald. A king's ransom of medicines was recently abandoned. They would greatly assist in rebuilding this sickly hamlet.
The power of the fishfolk grows with every moon! Light the ancient wards, and drain some of the natural power that they draw upon.
The unholy abominations inhabiting the crumbling house have turned beacons of Light into vessels for diabolical worship. Cleanse these altars with Consecrated Essence and bring back the Light.
The beast-men have erected crude and dirty shrines to their pagan Gods. Knock them down with pick-axe and might and impede their worship!
Blighted corpses lay strewn about the Old Road, teeming with filth and disease. Journeys to and from the Hamlet pose constant threat of sickness. Destroy this blight with Potent Salve.
A Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals in the shattered halls of your ancestral home. It must be stopped.
Deep within the shattered vaults of your ancestral home, a Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals even raising the dead! It must be stopped.
Stunned by the apparent value of the thing concealed amidst its putrid feathers, onlookers wondered if a trek to its perch might not be in order...
The creature's power waxes terrible. Recover the protective relics from the long-abandoned base camp, but beware the Shuffling Horror.
The creature's gestation must be interrupted! Overwhelm the defending force and illuminate the beacons - force the Thing to reveal itself prematurely!
Your enemy is vast, sprawling, and must be destroyed from within. Slog through the twisting maze and find your way to its throbbing heart.
At last, the twisted heart of the world is laid bare for sword, or supplication.
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!

When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they can become {colour_start|harmful}AFFLICTED{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} in town, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_poison}blighted{colour_end}! If you wish, you can use {colour_start|notable}anti-venom{colour_end} from inventory to neutralize it. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}anti-venom{colour_end} while it's the injured hero's turn.

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleeding{colour_end}! If you wish, you can use a {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} from inventory to stop the flow. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} while it's the injured hero's turn.

Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}. During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food! {colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Rest Points{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation.

This quest involves {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end}, and Camping requires {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end}. Firewood is {colour_start|notable}given automatically{colour_end} to you on appropriate quests. {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} gives heroes a chance to {colour_start|notable}recuperate while in the dungeon{colour_end}. When you are wounded or {colour_start|stressNOT1}stressed{colour_end} and wish to camp, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the firewood in your inventory.

Combat is {colour_start|notable}turn-based{colour_end}. On your hero's turn, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} a skill icon and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a highlighted target. If you can't select a particular skill, it's because that hero needs to be {colour_start|notable}standing in a different spot{colour_end} or there are {colour_start|notable}no valid targets{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Mouse Over]{colour_end} the skill to see the requirements.

The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}. The choice is yours. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[If this is the tutorial, retreat is unavailable.]{colour_end}
Discretion is the better part of valor...

While exploring, you will often find {colour_start|notable}interactive objects{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} to investigate them. Take a look at this tent...

When most monsters die, they leave corpses. Corpses act as temporary obstacles and will eventually go away on their own. You can attack corpses to destroy them faster, but often a better approach is to use ranged skills, push/pull skills, and even corpse-clearing special skills that some heroes possess. Monsters killed with bleed, blight, or crits leave no corpses at all!

When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}. While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}. Some heroes are better than others at disarming.
There isn't much more you can do in town right now. It's time to EMBARK on a quest! Click on the {colour_start|notable}[EMBARK]{colour_end} button at the bottom of the screen!

While in a {colour_start|notable}hallway{colour_end}, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[D]{colour_end} to move forward, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A]{colour_end} to move back. If you prefer the {colour_start|notable}mouse{colour_end}, you can {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} ahead or behind the party to move them.

{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}. If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to town before this happens. Death awaits us all.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's {colour_start|notable}image or portrait{colour_end} at any time to bring up a detailed panel showing all of the hero's {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}skills{colour_end}, and {colour_start|notable}resistances{colour_end}.

Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents.

The {colour_start|notable}Sanitarium{colour_end} is most often used to remove {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} and treat {colour_start|sanitarium_treatment_disease_entry}diseases{colour_end}. But you can also use it to reinforce a {colour_start|notable}positive quirk{colour_end}, which will lock it into place and prevent new positive quirks from displacing it. You can lock a maximum of 3 positive quirks per hero.

Each item, if you take it, will occupy space in your inventory. {colour_start|notable}Mouse over{colour_end} items to show details about them. This works in your inventory, too! (Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[ESC]{colour_end} to close this window.)
Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 active combat skills{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off to change your loadout, and watch how it changes that hero's positional strength in the display above!

You are currently in a {colour_start|notable}room{colour_end}. To move forth, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on {colour_start|notable}another room{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}map display{colour_end}. This will take you to the {colour_start|notable}connecting hallway{colour_end}.

You have unlocked the ability to begin a new, more challenging campaign! When you create a new save file, you will be prompted if you wish to enable the 'NG+' ruleset. Be warned, in an NG+ campaign, monsters are tougher, they hit harder, and losing too many heroes or taking too many weeks will result in failure! The stagecoach awaits...

Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Sanitarium.

On any screen in the game, press and hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[H]{colour_end} to see contextual help for controls in that mode. Try it while in town, exploring, fighting, camping, and more.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

Heroes who have returned from a successful quest in the Darkest Dungeon have seen too much. Depending on which game mode and game options you have selected, they may choose to never go back, or simply will be stressed upon re-entry.

Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works! However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} in turn determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} represents the hero's veteranship, and directly acts as {colour_start|notable}Stress Resistance{colour_end} against the horrors encountered in the dungeons. A low {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} hero that tries a higher level quest will quickly crumble under the unimaginable stresses.

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Secret Room{colour_end}! Advance to the tile marked with a star, and press 'W' or click to enter. Fabulous wealth and riches await those equipped with a {colour_start|notable}key{colour_end}...
You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.
The Stagecoach is Your Hero Lifeblood

Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

Heroes relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Tavern{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Abbey{colour_end}. Each activity has different side-effects. Experiment to find the best activity for each hero, depending on their {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}! Commiting a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

You'll want to take {colour_start|notable}different supplies{colour_end} depending on what {colour_start|notable}region{colour_end} you are going to, how {colour_start|notable}long{colour_end} the quest is, and your own preferences. But always bring some {colour_start|notable}food{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end}! For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.

The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level greatly affects many mechanics{colour_end} in the game. The darker it gets, the harder things get but the better the rewards. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a torch from inventory to boost the light back up.

Each hero has room to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just {colour_start|notable}drag the trinket{colour_end} from inventory over to the {colour_start|notable}selected hero's slot{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}VIRTUOUS{colour_end}! This elevated state of performance will last until they suffer a large amount of stress or return to town, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

Whatever awaits, it cannot be worse than what I've endured.
So I'm the final antique, yet nothing will be around to collect...
Please, no! I want to live!
Unholy foulness! I will take you with me!
A proper lady does not volunteer herself for slaughter!
Send me to hell then! AAAKYLORAAAHHH!
No way out. hmph. Let's do this.
Steady, girl. If we're called, we answer.
Hah! The joke's on me then...?

I go with a clear conscience. I've given my all.

UI overlay that gives icon hints to remind you of what items have worked on curios in the past.
Cannot be hit by attacks targeting only this slot.
Monsters with Stealth cannot be hit with direct attacks until Stealth expires or is negated with a hero skill. AOE attacks CAN hit stealthed monsters, though!
Armor Piercing attacks ignore a target's Protection Rating, which means none of the attack damage gets reduced by protection.

Monsters with {colour_start|stealth}STEALTH{colour_end} have a shadowy appearance and cannot be hit by direct attacks, but are vulnerable to area of effect attacks. Additionally, some hero skills, such as the Shieldbreaker's "Expose", can hit them while in {colour_start|stealth}stealth{colour_end}. These skills have the additional benefit of {colour_start|stealth}de-stealthing{colour_end} the monster.
We need to finish this fight quickly!
If we tarry, surely more will come!
Do not toy with this one! It may signal for more.
Let us be done with this rabble!
With diligence, labour, and a king's ransom of resources, our fair Hamlet may yet surpass even its past glories!

The Hamlet is growing, and news of your presence is emboldening craftsmen to return. You may now construct all-new buildings. They are expensive, but provide unique bonuses that may help you in your endeavors to cleanse the Estate.

Most District buildings require blueprints and heirlooms to build. Blueprints are dropped when bosses are killed. Color of Madness districts require shards, which are earned in the Farmstead. The Mill is unique in that it requires memories. Memories are mostly dropped in the Endless Harvest quest, by killing the Sleeper. Note: to gain access to all District buildings, you must purchase The Crimson Court DLC and The Color of Madness DLC.
The outer hamlet, where new buildings may be erected.
These rare loot items are age-old plans for expanding the Hamlet. They are consumed when constructing new buildings in the Districts. Blueprints are guarded by bosses.
The resurrection of our ramshackle Hamlet has lured brave artisans and merchants who see potential in the vacant lots surrounding the town square!

Interested in the latest official news and offers about Darkest Dungeon and Red Hook Studios? Please join the mailing list! We don't spam, and will never share your email address with third parties. Joining the list helps support us by letting us reach gamers like you directly!
